# City Income & Rent Dashboard (Canada, 2021)

## Overview
This project analyzes the relationship between median income and housing rent
across Canadian cities, with a focus on affordability using a rent-to-income ratio.

## Key Questions
- How strongly are income and rent correlated?
- Which cities are the most and least affordable?
- How does affordability vary across regions?

## Data
- Source: Public datasets (2021)
- Currency: CAD
- Unit of analysis: City

## Methodology
- Data cleaning and merging at city level
- Exploratory data analysis (EDA)
- Affordability metric: annual rent / annual income
- Ranking cities by affordability

## Outputs
- Interactive HTML dashboard
- Cleaned dataset for reuse
- Publication-ready visualizations

## Repository Structure
data/        # Raw and cleaned datasets
scripts/     # Reusable functions (loading, cleaning, plotting)
notebook/    # Executable R Markdown analysis
visuals/     # Exported charts
